subject: Ethics
title: Theranos Fraud
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Theranos Fraud.

hook.text: Elizabeth Holmes promised a machine that could run 200 blood tests from a single drop. It was a lie.

buildup.text: Theranos raised $700 million and was valued at $9 billion. Holmes was on magazine covers everywhere.

discovery.text: The technology never worked. Theranos secretly ran most tests on normal machines from other companies.

twist.text: Patients received wrong diagnosesâ€”some were told they had cancer when they didn't. Real lives were harmed.

climax.text: Holmes was convicted of fraud in 2022. The dream of disrupting healthcare became a cautionary tale.

punchline.text: Fake it till you make it doesn't work in medicine.

quiz.question: What real harm did Theranos's fraud cause beyond financial losses?
options: It caused a nationwide blood shortage by diverting supplies
Patients received incorrect medical diagnoses that affected their treatment
It prevented other legitimate blood-testing companies from receiving funding
